snippet: It was the first monthly contraction since 2009, partly because of a slowdown in orders from Asia and Europe.
abstract: Stocks initially fall on report that manufacturing activity declined in June, but recover.
lead_paragraph: It was the first monthly contraction since 2009, partly because of a slowdown in orders from Asia and Europe.

headline.seo: Shares Dip on Manufacturing Data, Then Recover
headline.main: U.S. Manufacturing Slips, Weighing on Stocks
headline.print_headline: Shares Dip on Manufacturing Data, Then Recover
